title: Workslop and Authentic Work
author: Sean Muggivan
objective: Analyze the concept of 'workslop'—AI-generated work that appears polished but lacks real value—and reflect on how thoughtful, authentic AI use applies to schoolwork and collaboration.

questions.question: What term do the authors use for AI-generated work that looks polished but lacks depth or usefulness?
According to the research, approximately what percentage of workers report encountering workslop in the last month?
The authors describe workslop as different from typical 'cognitive offloading' because:
options: It shifts mental work from humans to machines only.
It transfers cognitive labor from one human to another.
It eliminates the need for collaboration.
questions.answer: It transfers cognitive labor from one human to another.

questions.question: What is the average amount of time employees report losing per incident of workslop?
Which of the following emotions did more than half of respondents report feeling after receiving workslop?
What is one interpersonal consequence of workslop described in the article?
options: Colleagues view senders as less competent or trustworthy.
Work relationships become stronger through shared correction.
Managers become more confident delegating to AI users.
Workslop improves team morale over time.
questions.answer: Colleagues view senders as less competent or trustworthy.

questions.question: The 'pilot mindset' recommended by the authors combines which two traits?
What is the 'workslop tax' for an organization of 10,000 workers, based on the authors’ estimates?
According to the authors, indiscriminate mandates to 'use AI everywhere' result in:
options: Thoughtless copying and pasting of AI responses
questions.answer: Thoughtless copying and pasting of AI responses

questions.question: Which action do the authors recommend to combat workslop within teams?
options: Set clear guardrails and model thoughtful AI use
Allow AI tools to work unsupervised
Reward employees for quantity over quality
questions.answer: Set clear guardrails and model thoughtful AI use

questions.question: In 3–5 sentences, explain how the idea of 'workslop' might apply to using AI in high school. How can students use AI tools in a way that keeps their work authentic and valuable?
